name: Great Hornbill
description: A robust bird, unmistakable due to its striking coloration. Its head, body, and wings are black, while its belly, neck, and tail are white, with a broad black band on the tail. The beak and casque are yellow. Its eyes are dark, with prominent markings.
spread_note: Lives not only in India but also in China and Southeast Asia.
image_alt: Great hornbill, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 62–65 cm; tail length 33–40 cm; wingspan 151–178 cm; weight 2.1–3.4 kg
attractions: Outside the breeding season, it forms flocks of up to 200 individuals, often seen gathering at ripening fig trees. For nesting, it seeks prominent trees with spacious hollows, remaining faithful to them for years.
breeding: We have kept them continuously since 1955, when a pair arrived from Kolkata.
